H0.text: Mediterranean is the type of climate that the coast of California has.

H1.text: Rainforest is the type of climate the coast of California has.

H2.text: Tropical is the type of climate that the coast of California has.

H3.text: Arctic is the type of climate that the coast of California has.

A4.text: However, unshielded areas of that coastline can have warm-summer Mediterranean climates with hot-summer areas just a few kilometres inland.

A5.text: Csb climates are found in northwestern Iberian Peninsula (namely Galicia and the Norte region and west coast of Portugal), in coastal Northern California, in the Pacific Northwest (namely western Washington, western Oregon and southern portions of Vancouver Island in British Columbia), in central Chile, in parts of southern Australia and in sections of southwestern South Africa.
